title: Radiative Energy Loss in a Dynamically Evolving Quark-Gluon Plasma
abstract:
We present a theoretical formalism for calculating first-order in opacity
radiative energy loss, incorporating the spatial and temporal temperature
evolution of the Quark-Gluon Plasma (QGP) in a finite-size QCD medium with
dynamical (i.e., moving) constituents. The derived expressions allow for the
inclusion of arbitrary temperature profiles, enabling detailed calculations of
radiative energy loss across various evolution scenarios. This advancement is
crucial for utilizing high-$p_\perp$ observables to constrain QGP properties
through precision QGP tomography.
